title: Are these animal facts true or false?

questions.question: The elephant is the world's largest mammal.
questions.explanation: The blue whale, not the elephant, is the largest mammal.

questions.question: Sea otters sometimes hold hands while they sleep.
Centipedes have more legs than any other animal.
questions.explanation: The millipede is the animal with the most legs â€” some have as many as 750 legs. The centipede can have up to 354 legs.

questions.question: Mammals and dinosaurs coexisted.
questions.explanation: The first mammals appeared roughly 200 million years ago. Dinosaurs went extinct roughly 65 million years ago.

questions.question: Bears can't climb trees.
Camels store water in their humps.
questions.explanation: Camels store fat, not water, in their humps.

questions.question: Flamingos are pink because they eat shrimp.
The giant panda eats mostly bamboo.
questions.explanation: A giant panda's diet is almost entirely bamboo.

questions.question: The platypus is the only mammal that lays eggs.
questions.explanation: The platypus is one of two mammals that lay eggs. The other is the echidna.

questions.question: A mule is a cross between a male donkey and a female horse.

title: Which historical figure was born first?

questions.question: Which historical figure was born first?
questions.explanation: Confucius (551 BC) was born before Julius Caesar (100 BC).

questions.question: Which historical figure was born first?
questions.explanation: Mahatma Gandhi (1869) was born before Fidel Castro (1926).

questions.question: Which historical figure was born first?
questions.explanation: Nelson Mandela (1918) was born before Anne Frank (1929).

questions.question: Which historical figure was born first?
questions.explanation: Cleopatra (69 BC) was born before Muhammad (circa 570).

questions.question: Which historical figure was born first?
questions.explanation: Joan of Arc (circa 1412) was born before William Shakespeare (1564).

questions.question: Which historical figure was born first?
questions.explanation: Sun Tzu (544 BC) was born before George Washington (1732).

questions.question: Which historical figure was born first?
questions.explanation: Genghis Khan (circa 1160) was born before Leonardo da Vinci (1452).

questions.question: Which historical figure was born first?
questions.explanation: Karl Marx (1818) was born before Queen Victoria (1819).

questions.question: Which historical figure was born first?
questions.explanation: Marilyn Monroe (1926) was born before Saddam Hussein (1937).

questions.question: Which historical figure was born first?
questions.explanation: Albert Einstein (1879) was born before Mao Zedong (1893).

title: Which country had more people in 2019?

questions.question: Germany or France?
questions.explanation: Germany (84 million) has more people than France (65 million).

questions.question: Japan or South Korea?
questions.explanation: Japan (127 million) has more people than South Korea (51 million).

questions.question: Brazil or Argentina?
questions.explanation: Brazil (211 million) has more people than Argentina (45 million).

questions.question: Egypt or Botswana?
questions.explanation: Egypt (100 million) has more people than Botswana (2 million).

questions.question: Mexico or Guatemala?
questions.explanation: Mexico (128 million) has more people than Guatemala (18 million).

questions.question: Panama or Belize?
questions.explanation: Panama (4 million) has more people than Belize (390,000).

questions.question: Jamaica or Haiti?
questions.explanation: Haiti (11 million) has more people than Jamaica (3 million).

questions.question: Greece or Norway?
questions.explanation: Greece (10 million) has more people than Norway (5 million).

questions.question: China or India?
questions.explanation: China (1.43 billion) has more people than India (1.37 billion).

questions.question: Iraq or Iran?
questions.explanation: Iran (83 million) has more people than Iraq (39 million).

title: Are these science facts true or false?

questions.question: Mars has one moon, just like Earth.
questions.explanation: Mars has two moons, Phobos and Deimos.

questions.question: Scurvy is caused by a deficit of vitamin C.
Brass is made from iron and copper.
questions.explanation: Brass is made of zinc and copper, not iron and copper.

questions.question: One tablespoon of oil has more calories than one tablespoon of butter.
questions.explanation: One tablespoon of oil has roughly 120 calories, while one tablespoon of butter can contain up to 110 calories.

questions.question: Helium is the lightest element.
questions.explanation: The lightest element is hydrogen, not helium.

questions.question: The common cold is caused by bacteria.
questions.explanation: The common cold is caused by viruses, not bacteria.

questions.question: The deepest place on Earth is in the Pacific Ocean.
Seasons are caused by the earth orbiting the sun in an elliptical path.
questions.explanation: Seasons are caused by the tilt of the earth's axis.

questions.question: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system.
The atoms in a solid are more densely packed than the atoms in a gas.
